title: How good are Lithium Polymer batteries? - Quora

response.answer_text: Lithium-polymer batteries have their own pros and cons. Lithium-polymer batteries are robust and flexible (size and shape of their build). They are also lightweight and lower chance of suffering leakage of electrolyte causing explosions or fire. But lithium-polymer batteries are significantly more costly to manufacture, and they do not they have the same energy density (amount of power that can be stored) nor the lifespan that of lithium-ion batteries.
